Class com.polk.utils.General_Dialog 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----java.awt.Component
           |
           +----java.awt.Container
                   |
                   +----java.awt.Window
                           |
                           +----java.awt.Frame
                                   |
                                   +----com.polk.utils.General_Dialog
public abstract class General_Dialog
extends Frame
Puts up a dialog with the component in the top half of the dialog and a set of buttons in the bottom half. There are four standard buttons that can be added, Yes, No, Cancel, OK. The constants for them should be orred together, i.e. GeneralDialog.OK | GeneralDialog.CANCEL. The caller should call show_dialog() after he or she is done adding buttons. The predefined buttons and the close box both call Frame.dispose(). There are methods to override to customize the behavior. Any buttons created by the caller will have no action listeners defined.

CANCEL
NO
OK
YES

General_Dialog(Component, String)
General_Dialog(Component, String, int)

add_button(Button)
Puts a button into the row of buttons at the bottom of this dialog.
handle_cancel()
Default action for the Cancel button.
handle_close()
Default action when the user chooses to close the dialog.
handle_no()
Default action for the no button.
handle_ok()
Default action for the OK button.
handle_yes()
Default action for the yes button.
show_dialog()
Should be called after the constructor is called, and all of the buttons have been added.

OK
